hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: browser
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Choose which Browser to use when you test.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: run_number
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: How many times you want to test each page

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# TODO: Should run the built container from docker-compose not a new sitespeed.io one. run_sitespeed="sudo docker run \ --name sitespeed \ --volumes-from=jenkins \ --network=host \ --cap-add=NET_ADMIN \ --privileged \ --shm-size=2g \ --rm \ -v \ \"$(echo $SITESPEED_REPORT_PATH)\":/sitespeed.io/sitespeed-result sitespeedio/sitespeed.io:12.1.0-plus1 \ -e REPLAY=true \ -e LATENCY=100 \ -n $run_number \ -c 3gfast \ -b $browser \ --browsertime.viewPort 1920x1080 \ --speedIndex \ --visualElements \ --chrome.timeline true \ --video \ --sustainable.enable \ --graphite.host localhost \ --graphite.port 2003 \ --graphite.httpPort 8080 \ $additional_args \ $URL"
eval $run_sitespeed
report_dir_name=$(echo $URL | awk -F/ '{print $3}') sudo rm -rf "$WORKSPACE/frontend_report" && sudo mkdir "$WORKSPACE/frontend_report"
# TODO: Not sure this is needed, I could do it from FrontendJob.xml directly using the Jenkins assests. cd "/var/lib/sitespeed.io/sitespeed-result/$report_dir_name/" sudo cp -r $(ls -Art | tail -n 1)/* "$WORKSPACE/frontend_report"
